text:
NAEB Active Member Television Stations
The development, organization, financing, and programming of educational
television (etv) stations vary sharply from one to the other. Their functions and
policies differ also from commercial television. With the rapid development and
utilization of etv and its growing acceptance by the public and educators, the
services of a central, national organization has become increasingly important.
The NAEB, with more than a quarter of a century of educational broadcast¬
ing experience, provides the organizational structure for satisfying the needs of
those working in, for and (or with) etv. (Etv network programs distribtuion is the
function of the Educational Television and Radio Center.)
(Listed alphabetically by state, station location, call letters and licensee as of April 1959)
